info.question: If your S3 buckets are routinely receiving > ______ PUT/LIST/DELETE requests per second, you need to optimize for performance
If your S3 buckets are routinely receiving > ______ GET requests per second, you need to optimize for performance
Which is the performance optimization guidance for GET-intensive workloads?
answers: Use CloudFront content delivery service to get best performance
Use a random prefix to key names (like a hex hash), you can force S3 to distribute your keys across multiple partitions, distributing the I/O workload
Use of sequential key names e.g. names prefixed with a timestamp or alphabetical sequence to increase the likelihood of having multiple objects stored on the same partition
Use CloudTrail content delivery service to get best performance
correctAnswer: Use CloudFront content delivery service to get best performance

info.question: Which is the performance optimization guidance for mixed request workloads?
answers: Use CloudFront content delivery service to get best performance
Use a random prefix to key names (like a hex hash), you can force S3 to distribute your keys across multiple partitions, distributing the I/O workload
Use of sequential key names e.g. names prefixed with a timestamp or alphabetical sequence to increase the likelihood of having multiple objects stored on the same partition
Use CloudTrail content delivery service to get best performance
correctAnswer: Use a random prefix to key names (like a hex hash), you can force S3 to distribute your keys across multiple partitions, distributing the I/O workload

info.question: S3 uses the ______ to determine which partition an object will be stored in
S3 can support at least ______ put requests per second
S3 can support at least ______ get requests per second
What is the S3 website url format?
S3 provides unlimited storage
What is the HTTP code you would see once you successfully place a file in an S3 bucket?

You are hosting a static website in an S3 bucket that uses Java script to reference assets in another S3 bucket. For some reason, these assets are not displaying when users browse to the site. What could be the problem?
answers: You haven not enabled Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) on the bucket where the assets are stored
Amazon S3 does not support Javascript
You cannot use one S3 bucket to reference another S3 bucket
You need to open port 80 on the appropriate security group in which the S3 bucket is located
correctAnswer: You haven not enabled Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) on the bucket where the assets are stored

info.question: The minimum file size allowed on S3 is 1 byte
How does S3 determine which partition to use to store files?
answers: The bucket name determines which partition the file is stored in
S3 automatically stores your files on a random partition
The key name determines which partition the file is stored in
By default, all files in the same bucket are stored on the same partition
correctAnswer: The key name determines which partition the file is stored in

info.question: Your application is consistently reading and writing 100s of objects per second to S3 and your workload is steadily rising. What can you do to achieve the best performance from S3?
answers: Configure an additional bucket and distribute the files evenly between the two buckets
Configure a CloudFront CDN and use the S3 bucket as the origin
Add a hex hash prefix to the objects key name
Add a hex hash suffix to the objects key name
correctAnswer: Add a hex hash prefix to the objects key name
